meanings.definition: Not of this world; spiritual or ethereal.
meanings.sent1: The painting depicted an unworldly scene of angels and heavenly light.
meanings.sent2: She had an unworldly aura about her, as if she belonged to another realm.
meanings.sent3: His unworldly belief in magic made him think his pet rabbit could talk.
meanings.sent4: The music was so unworldly, it felt like being transported to a mystical land.
meanings.sent5: The unworldly beauty of the sunset took my breath away.

meanings.definition: Lacking knowledge or experience of the world; naive.
meanings.sent1: Her unworldly innocence made her an easy target for scams.
meanings.sent2: He had an unworldly trust in strangers, which often led to trouble.
meanings.sent3: It was unworldly how he believed everything he read on the internet.
meanings.sent4: The unworldly child thought the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent5: His unworldly nature made him vulnerable to deceit.

meanings.definition: Not concerned with material or worldly things.
meanings.sent1: The monk lived an unworldly life, detached from possessions.
meanings.sent2: Her unworldly attitude towards money baffled her friends.
meanings.sent3: It was unworldly how he never cared about owning the latest gadgets.
meanings.sent4: The unworldly artist valued creativity over financial success.
meanings.sent5: His unworldly mindset brought him inner peace amidst chaos.
